s.text: (2) preparation of a quality assurance plan with data quality objectives; (3) preparation of written descriptions of laboratory standard operating procedures (SOP's) for test organism culturing, toxicity testing, instrument calibration, sample chain-of-custody, laboratory sample tracking system, etc.; and (4) provision of adequate, qualified technical staff and suitable space and equipment to assure reliable data.
The DO must be maintained at a minimum of 4.0 mg/L for marine and warm water, freshwater species, and 6.0 mg/L for cold-water, freshwater species.
The results will depend upon the species used and the strain or source of the test organisms, and test conditions such as temperature, DO, food, and water quality.
After two years of data collection, or a minimum of 20 data points, the control chart should be maintained using only the 20 most recent data points.

If the toxicity value from a given test with the reference toxicant falls well outside the expected range for the test organisms when using the standard dilution water, the laboratory should investigate sources of variability, take corrective actions to reduce identified sources of variability, and perform an additional reference toxicant test during the same month.
After two years of data collection, or a minimum of 20 data points, the control chart should be maintained using only the 20 most recent data points.
This is especially true for the unsaturated fatty acid content of brine shrimp nauplii, Artemia.
Upon arrival at the test site, organisms are transferred to receiving water if receiving water is to be used as the test dilution water.
Droppers, and glass tubing with fire polished edges, 4 mm ID -- for transferring test organisms.
If this group does not show excessive mortality or obvious signs of stress in a few hours, the remainder of the test organisms are transferred to the dilution water.
